;Not to be watched

;

;On June 11, 2023, during the Shanghai International Film Festival, director Wang Mu arrived at the cafe we ​​agreed on nearly an hour early, and happened to be in There was a queue behind me for coffee. His directorial debut "The Gentle Shell" was released in theaters across the country at the end of May. It was in theaters for 10 days and grossed more than 12 million yuan at the box office. This result is incomparable with the commercial films that became popular in the summer and often grossed billions at the box office, but as a small- to medium-cost literary film, the performance is really good. On August 2, "Gentle Shell" was released on streaming media.

;

;Preparations for the film began in 2018. Wang Mu has been to four mental rehabilitation institutions and had in-depth conversations with many friends who have emotional problems. In the final film, social issues became the background, and he focused on the emotions of two people -

;

;The girl Juexiao could not accept her mother's departure and kept searching. She suffered a mental breakdown and even committed suicide by cutting her wrists (;Attempt;); The boy Dai Chun suffers from bipolar disorder. His father is an alcoholic, has left home, and is suffering from dementia in old age. Dai Chun and Jue Xiao, who were at a low point in their lives, met in a mental rehabilitation center. The two people, who had not been listened to or understood before, hugged each other for warmth in a closed environment and built a "gentle shell" to comfort their mental pain.

;

;In mid-June, the film’s promotion work came to an end. "Too many people's attention makes me feel stressed." Wang Mu said with a smile. He is not a talkative creator. Regarding questions such as "Has the director's debut experience accumulated experience for subsequent screenwriting and directing work?" and "Do you usually read books with a theme?", he answered "yes", nodded, and then fell into silence.

;

;Wang Mu was doing drama more than ten years ago, and his first play was performed in Chaoyang Jiu Theater. Since he couldn't find an actor, he played the role himself. On the stage, all he felt was darkness, and he couldn't see the audience. It was raining outside, seeping from the theater ceiling to the stage. In my memory, it looked like a water curtain hole. Wang Mu added an impromptu line, "Look how rainy it is." The audience immediately responded with applause, and he caught what would have been a stage mishap. In the second game, more spectators and media came to attend, and two more rows of seats were added in front of the first row of seats. As soon as Wang Mu came on stage and saw "so many viewers suddenly attracted", he realized that he was being watched and never went on stage again.

;

;He doesn't want to be watched.

;

;After the COVID-19 epidemic has passed, road shows seem to have become very important whenever a movie is released. It has become a routine operation for the main creative staff to go to various cities to participate in post-screening activities of various movie fan viewing groups. Wang Mu and his "Gentle Shell" are no exception. It was okay, he said, at least we were talking about movies. As for the fashion magazine trend of dressing directors in branded clothes and taking photos in absurd man-made landscapes, he still doesn't feel comfortable with it.

;

;It took me two years to write and rewrite the script. When he had further ideas for the script, he suddenly felt something in his heart and wrote a 7,000-word letter to Jue Xiao and Dai Chun in his home study, writing about his feelings for them and about himself.

;

;"What is it about," I asked.

;

;“My colleagues in publicity also asked me if I wanted to post it. I didn’t post it because I felt that it belonged to Dai Chunjuexiao at that time. From the bottom of my heart, I didn’t want people to know what I wrote.”

;

;In 2023, Wang Mu is 36 years old. A movie of his own is released and the response is good. What next? He wasn't sure. During the interview, he said several times that he would like to try to make commercial films in the future, so that the core of what he wants to express can reach the public in a more popular way. This is actually very difficult.

;

;A few years ago or more, Wang Mu thought about his ambition to be a professional screenwriter and strive to be the best? Is there still a chance to be a director? It seems like neither. When he was in his twenties or thirties, he thought, it would be great if he could be a person like Acheng. "Study aesthetics when you want to study aesthetics, and write things when you want to. You can write scripts for other directors, but you don't have to think about any remuneration, you don't have to think about contracts, you don't have to meet with people every day, and you don't care much about reviews, or I care too much about the so-called award results, as if that state is particularly good. I live in a very free and willful state."

;

;But I can't do it. No one can do it, and there is no need for such people in this era, he said.

;

;;

;

;Stills from the movie "Gentle Shell", Wang Ziwen and Yin Fang;(provided by interviewee/picture);

;

;Consensus and Resonance

;

;Unlike many young directors, Wang Mu is not a cinephile, nor a believer of the New Wave or a certain film master.

;

;Before taking the theater exam, he had no habit of watching movies. The first movie he actively watched in his life was "The 400 Blows". He bought a pirated disc and watched it in a small hotel room. Antoine "enshrined Balzac like a shrine", and this child in France in the 1950s seemed to be a reflection of his inner world. The movie ends abruptly when Antoine leaves home, and Wang Mu is greatly shocked. "I still can't forget that touching feeling. It's an unprecedented feeling. It's very wonderful. It turns out that this is what the movie is like." After going to college, he watched "The 400 Blows" again at a classmate's house, only to find that the disc he had bought had an error in the recording. Without the famous long shot of Antoine running in film history, it would be different from the movie that shocked him.

;

;"I know in my heart that movies are only a part of life, and part of what I want to express will still be put on the stage." Wang Mu said that his biggest wish is to continue reading dramas in this life. . He has also been writing, sometimes as fragments, sometimes as notes, without sticking to a strict framework.

;

;Wang Mu did well in Chinese in middle school, but he didn’t understand why writing a composition should have a definite central idea. The first scene of "Waiting for Godot" was selected in the Chinese textbook - Wang Mu didn't know who the two characters were waiting for, and the two characters themselves might not know. Is they waiting for hope, death, or some other end? The ambiguous interpretation space and endless implication struck him.

;

;Write even if you read too much. He later revised and re-wrote a play he wrote in high school. It was staged in 2007 and performed twice in Beijing. The core of the play is a bit like "Waiting for Godot", the protagonist is also waiting for something. That year, Wang Mu was 20 years old. He was fascinated by the chemistry in the theater. The stage was set up before the performance and dismantled after the performance. He sat alone in the audience for a long time.

;

;While working in the drama industry until 2010, Wang Mu only rehearsed that one play. He did not go into details about that experience, but he probably mentioned that it was not easy to do theater in Beijing, and that one had to endure poverty and accept the trap culture. "Later on, I slowly got into movies. For work, I wrote scripts for others. When I got tired of writing one movie after another, I decided that I still wanted to make a movie myself, and that's where I am today." He concluded.

;

;In 2012, a friend introduced him to a man named Li Xiaofeng. Li Xiaofeng read two novels written by Wang Mu. They were realistic, special in tone, and solemn in rhythm. Their literary skills left an impression on him. After getting acquainted, Li Xiaofeng learned that Wang Mu liked Chekhov the most. He went to Wang Mu's house and saw a heavy bust of Lu Xun placed on the desk. "He is a very serious creator at heart." Li Xiaofeng commented.

;

;Li Xiaofeng said he wanted to make a movie, so he handed over the Green Demon's novel "Girl Nezha" and asked Wang Mu if he thought it could be made. The novel tells the adolescent worries of two girls in Baocheng in the form of letters. In Li Xiaofeng's memory, almost everyone around him opposed the revision of the novel and found it difficult.

;

;Wang Mu said at the time, yes. Looking back now, Wang Mu said with a smile, "I'm not sure he can do it, but since he wants to shoot, I will at least have an income."

;

;Li Xiaofeng emphasized that the creator must have a lot of personality and personality. Mutual trust is needed in terms of talent. "Thinking about the world, love for people, and views on people in life" are more important than agreement on specific creations.

;

;The first draft of the script of "Girl Nezha" was written by Wang Mu, which "brought the best foundation." Li Xiaofeng commented that there were not many details in the original work that could be used for film shooting, and Wang Mu Mu's script "draws out all the characters' dynamics of the two girls, very realistically." After that, another screenwriter Pan Yu joined and wrote another draft.

;

;Movies are supposed to be collective creations, but they happen to be not. "This draft of the script was written by Wang Mu, and it is Wang Mu's characteristics. The next draft will have the characteristics of others. We will not necessarily discuss, quarrel, and finally reach an agreement. What is very important to me is that the movie is not about Twist everyone together and unify them into a certain specific pursuit, but let the light and brightness of these creators shine through their own work, and try to draw on each other's strengths as much as possible. This is the method I like." Li Xiaofeng said , they were young at that time, twenty-four or five years old, creative but not immature.

;

;The last film "Girl Nezha" (;2015;) was nominated for the Best of the 51st Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival Adapted Screenplay Award.

;

;“You have to believe in the power of free creation. It may not be stable, but it will keep your body and mind healthy.” Li Xiaofeng said. He and Wang Mu also collaborated on "Rebirth from the Ashes" (;2017;), about the impact of a murder case on two men many years later. Lasting impact. When the script reached the seventh draft, Wang Mu joined in, making it more literary. The collaborators have a consensus that they want to use the film to describe the state of the individual after "all solid things have disappeared" in fictional time and space.

;

;In this industry that relies on seniority and charlatanism, Wang Mu described the congeniality between creators as unquantifiable as possible, "He may feel some kind of sincerity in you. Or he will let you write the parts he needs." The directors who come into contact with him do not measure the screenwriter's ability by awards or box office, and they do not require that the script must be written like a script. Some people say that you can write novels. Another director allowed him to write the outline as a diary. "It must be in a comfortable context," Wang Mu emphasized.

;

;“Everyone will continue to move forward on his own creative path. We are different creators, but we can have a good consensus or resonance at the intersection of time and space. , I think it is very precious." Li Xiaofeng said.

;

;Li Xiaofeng still remembers that "Girl Nezha" participated in the venture capital film festival for the first time, and Wang Mu drafted the outline. At that time, Li Xiaofeng had not yet become a director. Before giving a PPT lecture, in the office, Wang Mu gave Li Xiaofeng advice like a drama director giving a lecture to an actor: Director, I think you should give a speech like this. Li Xiaofeng didn't remember the specific suggestions, but he remembered the status of the two of them very clearly, "There is no distinction between positions. It is the creator and the creator who are together. This feeling is quite rare today."

;

;A movie of one's own

;

;In July 2023, the film "Galaxy Writer" won the Best Screenplay Award at the FIRST Youth Film Festival, vividly showing the screenwriter as a "service industry" (< span style="font-family: Kaiti, Kaiti_GB2312, STKaiti;">;Lines in the film;) The dilemma of practitioners: I am lucky enough to be favored by the producer, and I keep having meetings. Change, add roles, change people; the producer talks, the director talks, the investors talk; every link is tortured, and finally it returns to the starting point.

;

;Wang Mu said that she used to not be the kind of professional screenwriter who could hold meetings and take jobs regularly. The most satisfactory way is to write a draft, revise it once you feel it, send it to the director after revising it, and then make no more revisions. If the director is not satisfied, he can overturn it. His job ends the moment he delivers the script.

;

;He also worked with other directors whom he admired very much, but those scripts were not produced in the end, so he felt that there was no need for him to mention them to the public. As a movie was aborted, Wang Mu knew that writing a drama would have a greater chance of being filmed and would earn a higher income.

;

;During his years as a screenwriter for literary films, he seemed to be in a paradise, able to gain maximum freedom in a small world. Writing a play is different. A bunch of people have a meeting and try to solve script problems using theories or methods. He wasn't quite sure what the people he was meeting with wanted. Listening to everyone talking about the terminology in the screenwriting book, I felt bored and tired.

; It is a 12-episode crime drama that carefully describes the relationship between two people who conspired to kidnap. It is quite special. When talking about character relationships and criminal motives during the interview, Wang Mu took "Crime and Punishment" as an example. Dostoevsky described in detail the long panorama of Raskolnikov's life before committing murder, "writing crime to the bone."

;

;In 2018, he decided to make a movie of his own. After paying attention to someone suffering from depression or bipolar disorder, he was surprised by the size of this group and wanted to photograph people suffering from mental distress. In August, at Dalian Guoli Hospital, he walked through the unlocked iron gate and saw a pretty girl and a boy keeping a fixed distance behind her. "He always keeps a fixed distance from the girl and never disturbs her life." Wang Mu wrote in his diary.

;

;The appearance of Dai Chun and Jue Xiao in "Gentle Shell" is a bit like the boy and girl Wang Mu saw.

;

;“Many people think that when a writer turns to a director, you just finish the script and others do the rest for you. That’s impossible. You have to cooperate with different people to make them understand you. "In general, a self-isolated creator must throw himself into an industrial structure, deal with different people, constantly persuade and compromise. To solve the problem, he can no longer escape from these.

;

;Judging from the results, Wang Mu did a good job. The first draft of the script of "Gentle Shell" won the award in the venture capital section of the Pingyao Film Festival, with a bonus of 100,000. He tried filming footage, went to the Hainan Island International Film Festival for venture capital, won an award, and had start-up capital. Start looking for investors and talking about actors.

;

;The actor's past performance inertia needs to be respected, and a balance must be found between the actor's ideas and his own creation.

;

;"I think the most awesome thing about directors and producers is that they can choose accurately. It's not as good as being accurate on the spot. Right?" Baike said that the role that made him famous was comedy. The narcissistic and self-deprecating grassroots king Sledgehammer in "Never Expected". Wang Mu asked him to play Dai Chun's younger brother Dai He, a middle-aged man who wants to break away from his cursed native family and work hard for his own future. He has a strong sense of worldly fatigue.

;

;On Wang Ziwen’s birthday, he received a painting from Wang Mu, in which a little girl was holding a lantern and an elephant was beside her. "He thought I was such a little girl." Wang Ziwen said. When Wang Mu asked her to play Jue Xiao, she thought, why would she let me play such a gentle person? "Qu Xiaoxiao (;Wang Ziwen's character in "Ode to Joy";) is rebellious, powerful, or very sassy , Quirky, this is what most people think of me when they talk to me about roles." Wang Mu saw her vulnerability and tenacity.

;

;"Gentle Shell" was shot in the order of the development of the story. Wang Mu almost never called for startup or interrupted, trying to capture the state of real life. Juexiao is reserved, Dai Chun is simple, and Dai He is depressed. Wang Ziwen, Yin Fang, and Baike supported each other and contributed delicate performances. At the beginning of 2023, "Gentle Shell" won three awards: "Fei Mu Honor·Best Director", "Fei Mu Honor·Best Actress", and "Fei Mu Honor·Best Actor" at the 6th Pingyao International Film Festival Grand prize.

;

;For movies, from the feeling of pictures, rhythm and imagination to the specific production process. Wang Mu feels that it is a pity that he should be more patient and spend more time, "I will tell each person more specifically - even if it is a person who has no lines and is just standing in the background - I will tell him myself. Play, communicate, and build a relationship with him." If we do this, there may not be many unsatisfactory things that need to be cut out in the later stage.

;

;"There are too many problems." He even said so.

;

;He told a story. After Dai Chun's father committed suicide, he walked to the overpass with blood on his body, waiting for Jue Xiao to appear. The original audio-visual focus was on Dai Chun. Looking back after half a year, Wang Mu realized that Juexiao also had to go through a very difficult journey. There should be a longer shot of Jue Xiao struggling through the crowd.

;

;He comforted himself that he would work hard on the next one.

;

;After all this, a young director was born.

;

;;

;

;Stills from the movie "Gentle Shell", Yin Fang and Baike;(provided by interviewee/picture);;

;Be gentle

;

;There are two short stories about Wang Mu, which happened before the filming and release of the movie.

;

;In February and March 2020, at the beginning of the COVID-19 outbreak, Wang Mu found that he could not watch the news. Contemporary writers who write so well cannot withstand the impact of the present. Great suspicion hung over him. He immersed himself in ancient books, from "Water Margin" to "Guanwen Guanzhi", "Yuewei Caotang Notes" and "Xuanguailu". The past world was not connected with the present. "It gave me a lot of healing and release, and I could escape inside." But he felt like a Taoist priest from Mount Laoshan, losing himself in the vast world of ancient literature and in danger of falling into historical nihilism.

;

;In March 2020, Wang Mu’s son was born. In addition to letting him take the initiative to end this time as a Taoist priest in Laoshan (;those He sold all the books;), which also made "Gentle Shell" more gentle. "Gentle Shell" started filming in October 2020. The filming location was changed from the bleak Dalian in early spring to the gentle Quanzhou, and was completed 41 days later. What he wanted the film to do was to get closer and understand, rather than watch and observe.

;

;After the movie was released, Wang Mu posted a self-report on Douban: "My academic path was quite satisfactory, my career as a screenwriter was tepid, I loved theater, but I had no chance to rehearse plays in thirteen years, so I acted recklessly. I wanted to make a movie, but I had no idea that in the process, I might have brought burdens to others. As I approach my forties, looking back at these things, I feel lucky that there are always people in my life who are gentle to me."

; < p>;At the end of the film, Dai Chun and Jue Xiao still have unresolved life problems, but in the shell they built, they finally have the happiness of ordinary people. After the end credits appeared, a childish voice called mom and dad. That was the voice of Wang Mu's son.

;

;After the film is finished filming, it will be a long wait until it is released. When Wang Mu was anxious, he saw on Douyin that someone was cutting wood to build a house and make coffee in the wilderness. He watched it for a long time. It feels so good to accomplish something alone. He bought wood online and focused on it for six or seven hours, sawing the wood, sanding it into a shape, and applying wax. Very cool. He made a small wooden horse and a bird and gave them to his son. Of course, his son thought such toys were too boring and didn't know where to put them.

;

;During that time, he also carved seals, bought stones in an online store, and followed the book given by the store to learn to carve "The best is like water." The operation is highly standardized, has nothing to do with art, and is very decompressive. Now Wang Mu has uncarved stones and uncarved wood in his house. This is all half-measures.

;

;But he also knows very well that when it comes to other matters related to creation, he will not give up halfway.

;

;(Thanks to Meng Yiyi and Yang Nan for their help with this article.)

;On September 25, 2023, Chusovitina competed in the vaulting competition at the Hangzhou Asian Games Afterwards, he greeted the audience ;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;On the afternoon of September 28, 2023, the women’s vault final of competitive gymnastics at the Hangzhou Asian Games ended , Oksana Chusovitina did not win a medal, but every time she landed on a jump, she sparked bursts of cheers and applause in the venue.

;

;In the preliminaries, Chusovitina advanced to the finals in fifth place. After the game, she said that she would increase the difficulty in the finals and attack the medals. She finally ranked fourth with a score of 13.383, leaving regrets on the field.

;

;;

;

;On September 29, 2023, Chusovitina held a press conference at the Hangzhou Asian Games;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo );

;

;Qiusowei Jinna’s score is not particularly high. North Korean athlete An Changyu, who won the gold medal, scored 14.049, and Chinese gymnast Yu Linmin, who won the third place, scored 13.533 points. An Changyu and Yu Linmin are 20 years old this year, while Qiusowei Jinna has passed her 48th birthday. Except for her, no other gymnast is still active in the world competition at this age. She did it and showed a first-class competitive level.

;

;In Chusovitina’s more than 40-year sports career, she retired three times and came back three times. She has told the outside world many reasons for persisting - for her son, for the country, for honor. But looking back at every comeback, you will find that she was reluctant to leave the sport.

;

;Looking at it from another perspective, gymnastics gave her hope that she could persevere. It was gymnastics that gave her the money and opportunity to heal her son, and gave her the sustenance to temporarily forget her pain during the most difficult period. , turning her from an ordinary person into a hero who brings glory to the country.

;

;Her life has long been integrated with gymnastics.

;

;;

;

;On September 28, 2023, Chusovitina won fourth place in the women's vault final of competitive gymnastics at the Hangzhou Asian Games; (Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;;When is the "last jump"? ;

;

;Chusovina has so far represented 3 countries and regions (including the CIS) in eight consecutive Olympic Games. Behind every change of nationality, there are historical and personal experiences. The turmoil of life.

;

;In 1975, Chusovitina was born in Bukhara, the former Soviet Union, now the capital of Bukhara Oblast in Uzbekistan. She began training in gymnastics when she was 7 years old. At the age of 13, she won the all-around championship in the Soviet Youth Gymnastics Competition. At the 1990 World Sports Expo in Japan, she won the individual all-around championship and all individual gymnastics championships except the high and low bars. At the 1991 World Rhythmic Gymnastics Championships, she won the championship in the floor exercise event and the runner-up in the women's vault event. However, there were many athletes of the same level as her in the Soviet gymnastics team.

;

;The afterglow of the Soviet Union shone in the 1992 Barcelona Olympics. The participating lineup of the Commonwealth of Independent States, composed of 11 former Soviet republics, was basically athletes trained during the Soviet period. The CIS team participating in the women's gymnastics team event was composed of 6 selected athletes from more than 30 athletes. Chusovitina was successfully selected, and the team also won the team gold medal without any surprise. Chusovitina feels that being selected into the participating team is more difficult than winning the championship.

;

;After the Barcelona Olympics, Chusovitina, like other athletes, returned to play in their respective countries. The training conditions in Uzbekistan are poor, and Chusovitina often practices on abandoned and unsafe equipment, but she has supported the honor of the entire country in the gymnastics world. From 1993 to 2006, Chusovitina participated in various gymnastics competitions for Uzbekistan and won 70 medals in international competitions.

;

;During this period, Chusovitina announced her retirement twice. The first time was in 1996 because of marriage; the second time was in 1999 because of pregnancy, but both retirements did not last long. From 1997 to 1998, she was still active in the international arena and played in the 1998 Bangkok Asian Games. After giving birth to her son Alyosha at the end of 1999, she quickly returned to preparations and participated in the 2000 Sydney Olympics.

;

;"I really decided at that time to end my gymnastics career." After giving birth, Chusovitina thought so, but when she stood on the training ground again, she was shaken again. "One time when I passed by the training hall, I saw the familiar training facilities and my former teammates. I walked to the mirror and looked at it. I felt that I was not old and could still bring honor to my motherland."

;

;This comeback started a long career journey for her. Perhaps she had never thought of persisting for so long. It was fate that pushed her into a desperate situation with no way out.

;

;;

;

;On December 4, 2006, Cologne, Germany, Chusovitina took a photo with her son before training;(Visual China/Photo );

;

;In 2002, Chusovitina participated in the Asian Games in Busan, South Korea, and won two gold medals and two silver medals with her super strength. When she called her mother and son to report the good news, she learned that her son had been diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia. "Fate always gives me the most fatal blow when I am happiest. I have not even begun to enjoy the joy of success." Chusovitina rushed home to find a doctor who could treat her son. The high medical expenses made her suffer. She was struggling. She and her husband sold all their belongings, but the money they raised was far from enough.

;

;On the other hand, Uzbekistan failed to fulfill its promise of bonuses for athletes to win Asian Games gold medals, so Chusovitina had to find another way. She began playing for a club in Germany, and in exchange, the other party provided Alyosha with treatment opportunities and financial support. "I decided at that time that I would participate in all the games I could, just to raise money for my son's treatment. I didn't care if these games were difficult or not, I just knew that when I was injured, I had to stand up and compete in other games. "She can't stop and she can't retire. "If I retire, I will sit by the hospital bed and watch my son die...Who will help a former world champion?"

;

;;

;

;1992 Barcelona Olympics, Chusovitina In the balance beam competition ; (Visual China/Photo);

;

;In 2006, Chusovitina joined Germany despite the pressure of public opinion about betraying her motherland. Nationality, competed for Germany in the 2008 and 2012 Olympic Games, and won a silver medal in the women's vault. After the London Olympics, Chusovitina was 37 years old, and her son fortunately recovered, but she did not choose to retire. In 2013, she re-naturalized as an Uzbek citizen and continued to compete in the world for herself and her motherland.

;

;As she grows older, Chusovitina truly feels the limitations of her physical fitness. In the women's gymnastics qualifying competition for the Tokyo Olympics, she made a mistake in landing on her first jump and her right foot went out of bounds. She still made a mistake in landing on her second jump and failed to advance to the finals. She cried on the sidelines after the game and announced her retirement the next day.

;

;Two months later, she decided to make a comeback again.

;

;;

;

;On August 17, 2008, Chusovitina showed off her silver medal after the women's vault award ceremony at the Beijing Olympic Games;(Xinhua News Agency/ Picture);

;

;;Where Love Begins;

;

;When Chusovitina made the decision to retire two years ago, no one doubted that she would Saying goodbye to gymnastics was a decision that seemed perfectly reasonable. She was 46 years old at the time. She had won awards in almost every competition in gymnastics, and her son had grown up safely and healthily. Many people told her that it was time to rest, and she thought so for a while.

;

;But two months after leaving gymnastics, she knew it was a foolish decision. In an interview with China News Weekly, she said: "Why should I give up something that brings me happiness? I have never dissuaded others from stopping work. Why would anyone dissuade me from stopping the work I like? Have you really abandoned it?"

;

;She returned to the training ground and insisted on practicing every day, although the time was much less than before. When she was young, she could train for seven or eight hours a day. Later, she became more and more aware that training needed to focus on method and efficiency. Now, she trains for three hours a day, but she records every move and every jump, and then reviews it carefully to try to adjust to the best condition for every attempt.

;

;During the preparations for the Hangzhou Asian Games, China International Television went to follow her training. When she faced the camera, she said: "I love learning. When I made a mistake during the jump, all of us were together. Work hard to correct it, and when we do this, my heart will be filled with joy." Every training session is an enjoyment for her, "This is not a vanity fair for athletes."

;

;Qiuso Virgina doesn't want to set an example or achieve any record, she just loves gymnastics. Even during the years when she competed to treat her son's illness, gymnastics was never a task she was forced to take on, but a solace in her life. "I just continue to do what I like, which makes me feel less uncomfortable. My mind is no longer occupied by those thoughts, so at that time, it was exercise that gave me a lot of relief."

;

;In many interviews, Chusovitina has mentioned that she fell in love with gymnastics at first sight. At that time, as the youngest child in the family, she was very naughty and was sometimes kicked out of kindergarten. ; Sat, 30 Sep 2023 19:25:03 +0800 江苏200多城投公司为何退出政府融资平台？http://www.infzm.com/contents/257800
;;2023-09-30 18:00:00;
;

;On September 12, 2023, two urban investment companies in Pizhou City, Jiangsu Province issued market-oriented transformation instructions, stating that The implicit debts of local governments have been paid off and they will no longer assume the financing function of public welfare projects in the future, promising that enterprises will operate independently and be responsible for their own profits and losses. This means that the two companies are no longer government financing platforms.

;

;Similar actions have occurred frequently across Jiangsu in the past year.

;

;According to statistics from Southern Weekend reporters, from December 2022 to the present (as of September 26, 2023), a total of 215 urban investment companies in Jiangsu have announced their withdrawal from government financing platforms, involving 7 prefecture-level cities including Suzhou and Changzhou. city. There are 13 prefecture-level cities in Jiangsu.

;

;In the same period, some urban investment companies in Henan, Liaoning and other provinces also announced their withdrawal from government financing platforms, but only a few of them. This time, why did Jiangsu take such drastic measures to ask local urban investment companies to withdraw from the government financing platform?

;

;;

;

;From December 2022 to the present (as of September 26, 2023), a total of 215 urban investment companies in Jiangsu have announced their withdrawal from government financing platforms, involving 7 prefecture-level cities including Suzhou and Changzhou . ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;;Four ways to exit government financing platforms;

;

;According to many urban investment practitioners in Jiangsu, the withdrawal of local urban investment companies from the government financing platform refers to the withdrawal from Jiangsu’s comprehensive local debt supervision platform.

;

;“Being the first in the country to establish a full-scale debt management system covering government debt, government implicit debt, and operating debt of financing platform companies.” In August 2023, the Jiangsu Provincial Audit Office announced the 2022 Provincial Audit results of level-level budget execution and other fiscal revenue and expenditures" said when reviewing the work in 2022.

;

;Implicit debt refers to debts borrowed by local governments beyond the statutory government debt limit, either directly or by promising to repay with fiscal funds, or by illegally providing guarantees. The debt-raising entities are usually local urban investment companies. Like government debt, local governments need to bear the repayment responsibility for implicit debts, while the operating debt of urban investment companies has nothing to do with the government.

;

;In June 2022, a procurement document from the Gansu Provincial Department of Finance showed that the Ministry of Finance had established a full-caliber debt monitoring platform system. Among them, the hidden debt monitoring system counts and monitors changes in existing hidden debts on a monthly basis. In addition, there is a system for real-time statistical monitoring of financing platform debt.

;

;In addition to the Ministry of Finance’s debt monitoring platform, Jiangsu has also established its own local debt supervision system.

;

;In June 2019, a procurement announcement issued by the Wuxi Municipal Finance Bureau revealed that according to the work deployment requirements of the Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection and the Provincial Department of Finance, the Wuxi Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection and the Wuxi Municipal Finance Bureau purchased debts in Xinwu District On the basis of the system, we will optimize, improve, deeply develop and pilot the comprehensive supervision system for local government debt.

;

; "The local government comprehensive debt supervision system has been affirmed by the Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection and Supervision, and has been designated for promotion and application in 13 prefecture-level cities across the province." The official website of Wuxi Big Data Administration Bureau said.

;

;People from urban investment companies in Guizhou and other places told Southern Weekend reporters that local urban investment debt data mainly relies on the statistics of the Ministry of Finance.

;

;“Regional governments should strengthen the full-scale debt monitoring and control of financing platform companies, and comprehensively understand the bottom line of government hidden debts, operating debts and contingent liabilities of financing platform companies.” In 2021, Jiangsu Province issued the “ "Guiding Opinions on Regulating the Investment and Financing Behavior of Financing Platform Companies" (hereinafter referred to as "Guiding Opinions on Financing Platforms").

;

;In other words, the operating debt of Jiangsu Urban Investment Company has also been included in the debt supervision system.

;

;But how do urban investment companies withdraw from government financing platforms? A table obtained by Southern Weekend reporters shows that a prefecture-level city in Jiangsu is compiling a list of urban investment companies that will withdraw from fiscal supervision in 2023.

;

;The table indicates that there are four types of exit: withdrawal from the regulatory scope due to the lifting of the guarantee relationship, cancellation (the debt has been cleared), merger into other platform companies (debts are transferred to other platform companies), and marketization Transform into a non-platform state-owned enterprise.

;

;Based on the announcements from local governments in Jiangsu, the main exit type of urban investment platforms is to transform into non-platform enterprises, which is generally expressed as: "Transform into market-oriented operating entities and withdraw from government financing platforms from the date of announcement." , no longer assumes government financing functions, operates independently in accordance with the law as an independent market entity, and is responsible for its own profits and losses."

;

;Urban investment companies across Jiangsu have transformed into non-platform state-owned enterprises and need to clear their hidden debts.

;

;In July 2022, Jiangdu District, Yangzhou City issued a financing platform integration and cleanup plan. The document states that for companies with a certain asset scale and management capabilities, the government's implicit debts will be paid off, financing functions will be divested, and market-oriented transformation will be achieved.

;

;A person who works for a city investment platform in Jiangsu told Southern Weekend reporters that the company’s hidden debts have been cleared before an announcement is made in 2022 to transform into a non-platform enterprise.

;

;According to statistics from Southern Weekend reporters, 8 of the 215 urban investment companies in Jiangsu that have withdrawn from government financing platforms have been cancelled. In addition, the above form requires filling in the reasons for the urban investment company to be placed under supervision, the balance of implicit debt, the balance of operating debt, and the type of exit.

;

;It is worth noting that industrial and commercial data show that among the 215 companies, 192 are subsidiaries at all levels and are not directly affiliated with administrative institutions. There are only 80 urban investment companies with renewal bonds, bank borrowings, accounts receivable financing, and financial leasing. Among them, only 7 companies have renewal bonds.

;

;If the urban investment company has financing capabilities, especially if it has issued bonds, it means that the company has a large asset scale and has certain operating capabilities, and is not a shell company. Data from the Enterprise Early Warning Channel show that among the 215 urban investment companies, the 2022 industrial and commercial information of 112 companies shows zero employees or no information.

;

;In other words, a large number of urban investment companies that have withdrawn from government financing platforms have small asset sizes or are shell companies.

;

;;Withdrawal from the original CBRC supervision list;

;

;In fact, there have been cases of urban investment companies withdrawing from government financing platforms.

;

;Around 2011, the former China Banking Regulatory Commission began to implement a "list system" management of urban investment platforms. The list was updated every quarter, which affected the financing activities of urban investment platforms such as bank loans and the issuance of public bonds.

;

;In 2019, the former China Banking Regulatory Commission suspended statistics on the list. Guangdong Securities Research Report shows that as of the end of 2018, there were 11,737 financing platforms on the list, of which 2,710 have been gradually removed, leaving 9,027.

;

;In the past decade or so, urban investment companies in various regions have withdrawn from government financing platforms, mainly referring to withdrawing from the supervision list of urban investment platforms by the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission.

;

;In December 2015, the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of Fujian Nanping City issued an announcement stating that by actively strengthening communication and approval with the government and the China Banking Regulatory Commission, one of its urban investment companies was officially withdrawn from the government financing platform, "marking the The company's market-oriented financing functions have been fully restored."

;

;In order to ease financing pressure, various places are trying to find ways to withdraw from the regulatory list. However, according to a document issued by the former China Banking Regulatory Commission in 2013, multiple conditions need to be met to exit the regulatory list of urban investment companies.

;

;For example, if the asset-liability ratio is below 70%, the financial report has been audited by an accounting firm; the part of existing loans that requires financial repayment has been included in local fiscal budget management, and the source of budget funds has been implemented, and the existing The mortgage guarantee, loan term, repayment method, etc. of the loan have been rectified and qualified.

;

;An urban investment practitioner in Jiangsu told a Southern Weekend reporter that another purpose for urban investment companies in various regions to withdraw from the original regulatory list of the China Banking Regulatory Commission is to participate in government PPP projects as social capital parties.

;

;In 2021, the former China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission issued the "Guiding Opinions on Banking and Insurance Institutions to Further Prevent and Resolve Local Government Hidden Debt Risks", requiring that it is strictly prohibited to provide current loans to borrowers who bear local government hidden debts. , it is strictly prohibited to add or falsely resolve hidden government debts, further limiting the financing space of urban investment companies.

;

;After the original CBRC urban investment supervision list stopped updating, it is still functioning.

;

;“There is a bank credit line, but the loan cannot be released.” Huang Hui, a staff member of an urban investment company in Shandong, told Southern Weekend reporters that after the above-mentioned Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission document was released, because it was on the regulatory list , the company's liquidity loans were greatly restricted. Since then, the company has repaid hidden debts through financial fund repayment and other methods. It was not until it was withdrawn from the regulatory list last year that financing returned to normal.

;

;In the past few years, urban investment companies in Henan, Liaoning and other places have also withdrawn from government financing platforms, but they have not specified what kind of platforms. In addition, multiple announcements show that county-level government units can approve the withdrawal of urban investment companies.

;

;In May 2020, the Tanghe County Government in Henan Province issued an announcement stating that after research and approval by the county government, it was decided that Tanghe County Hongxiang Investment Group Co., Ltd. would be a market-oriented transformation entity and would withdraw from the government from the date of the announcement. investment platform. In May 2022, the Dalian Pulandian District government also approved eight urban investment companies to withdraw from the government financing platform.

;

;In contrast, when urban investment companies across Jiangsu withdraw from financing platforms, they need to report to the provincial and municipal governments and wait for approval.

;

; "Since this year, 18 companies have applied to the province and city to withdraw from the financing platform supervision system." In September 2023, the "Sheyang County Party Committee's Report on the Progress of Inspections" was released on the official website of the Jiangsu Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection and Supervision. ” wrote.

;

;Based on the announcements of various localities withdrawing from financing platforms, the core content is to explain to the outside world that urban investment companies will no longer assume government financing functions and will separate subsequent borrowing from government debt.

;

;;Reduce the number of financing platforms;

;

;The official websites of Jiangsu county and district governments show that in 2022, Jiangsu will begin to reduce the number of urban investment platforms on a large scale and set goals .

;

;For example, Jurong City, Jiangsu Province released the "Pilot Work Plan for Reducing the Number of Financing Platform Companies from 2022 to 2026", which stated that the number of financing platform companies will be reduced year by year, and the number of 10 financing platform companies will be reduced by 2022. By 2023, it is planned to reduce the number of 15 financing platform companies.

;

;“Promote the integration, mergers, and market-oriented transformation of financing platform companies.” In July 2023, Wang Tianqi, Director of the Jiangsu Provincial Department of Finance, emphasized at a meeting that the high-cost debt “peak reduction operation” will continue to be carried out , implement “one account, one policy” guidance for financing platform companies with high market attention, large existing debt scale, concentrated payment periods, and tight capital chains.

;

;“Now when the person in charge of an urban investment company goes to the government for a meeting, the first thing he reports is not the current status of the company’s operations, but the situation of debt reduction.” A Jiangsu urban investment practitioner said that debt reduction and the extended Tasks such as financing platform integration are the most important things for urban investment companies at the moment.

;

;The government is accelerating the integration of financing platforms because Jiangsu has a large number of urban investment companies at the county, district and even town and street levels. They generally have heavy debt burdens, small market sizes, and poor operating capabilities.

;

;In May 2023, the Jiangsu Provincial State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission introduced in reply to a CPPCC proposal that among the province’s financing platform companies, county (district) level and development zone, functional zone and township-level financing platform companies accounted for Compared to nearly 90%. Judging from the total amount of state-owned assets and operating debt, counties (districts) account for more than half.

;

;Therefore, among the number of platforms to be reduced this time, county and township-level financing platforms are the focus. In the above form of a prefecture-level city in Jiangsu, it is required to fill in whether it is a township-level platform.

;

;Since 2023, government departments in Dafeng District of Yancheng City, Qingjiangpu District of Huai'an City, and Yangzhou District of Zhenjiang have successively issued announcements stating that all town-level financing platforms will be integrated into the district and county level, or that township-level financing platforms will be completely cancelled. platform.

;

;In 2022, the 14th Jiangsu Provincial Committee conducted two rounds of inspections in 44 counties and districts. Jiangsu has a total of 95 counties and districts. Public information shows that the rectification progress of the two rounds of inspections will be announced to the public in January 2023 and September 2023 respectively. On the eve of the announcement of the rectification progress, it was the time when urban investment companies intensively issued announcements to withdraw from the financing platform.

;

; Statistics from Southern Weekend reporters found that among the rectification reports of 44 counties and districts, 21 counties and districts mentioned the integration or reduction of the number of urban investment platforms.

;

;Wu Ming is an executive of a consulting company in Beijing, mainly providing transformation consulting services to urban investment platforms. He told Southern Weekend reporters that the withdrawal of financing platforms across Jiangsu was indeed related to inspections and rectifications.

;

;Wu Ming explained that some time ago, a Jiangsu urban investment platform contacted him, saying that after an inspection, he found that the local urban investment platform had heavy debts, dispersed assets, and many shell companies, and hoped to find a solution to reduce the number of platforms. Improve the financing capabilities of the capital market.

;

;;Can it be truly transformed;;? ;

;

;More than 200 urban investment companies in Jiangsu have withdrawn from the financing platform. What impact will it have on the market?

;

;On September 25, 2023, Huafu Securities statistics found that among the 287 urban investment companies across the country that had withdrawn from financing platforms, the bond trading activity on the bond issuance platform was not high. The average monthly transaction volume from January to August 2023 is generally low, mostly below 10%. Four platforms even had no transaction volume during the year. Their activity is generally low and they receive less attention from the capital market.

;

;Ren Hua is the person in charge of a financial leasing company in Shanghai. His main customer groups are urban investment platforms across Jiangsu. Ren Hua told Southern Weekend reporters that they had investigated the withdrawal of platforms in Jiangsu and found that none of the major financing platforms in various places had withdrawn.

;

; "If it is still a financing platform, urban investment bonds can be renewed by borrowing new ones and repaying old ones. But if it withdraws from the list, financing will depend on its ability." Ren Hua explained.

;

;Generally speaking, large and medium-sized urban investment companies have one or more strong main businesses. For smaller urban investment platforms, how to achieve true transformation and have sustainable operating capabilities without relying on government infrastructure and other projects is a more difficult problem.

;

;According to Wu Ming, when urban investment platforms across Jiangsu consulted him, "how to maintain sustainable operating capabilities" was also a frequently asked question.

;

;Based on the inspection and rectification reports of the above-mentioned 21 counties and districts, the approach taken by each locality is to integrate financing platforms for similar businesses and clarify the main business direction of each company.

;

;For example, Feng County’s inspection and rectification report stated that four groups were established: urban construction, industrial investment, agriculture and water, and Xinfeng, and their main businesses were respectively approved for urban construction, park development, agriculture and water tourism, and financial services. plate.

;

;In fact, compared with market-oriented transformation, cancellation and other methods, the resistance to integrating urban investment platforms is greater.

;

;“It’s like two families living together. The rich don’t like living with the poor.” An executive of an urban investment company in Guizhou told a Southern Weekend reporter that the local government had also planned to promote platform integration, but The effect is not good. "If a bad enterprise is integrated and one of its loans is overdue, the entire group will be overdue."

;

;In addition, the effect of the transformation of urban investment companies across Jiangsu remains to be seen.

;

;Huafu Securities research report shows that among the bond-issuing urban investment platforms that will withdraw from the platform in 2021-2022, except for Chibi Urban Construction, Licheng State Investment and other platforms, there are small-scale business fluctuations, and most urban investment platforms The role of undertaking local infrastructure business has not changed, the proportion of public welfare and quasi-public welfare business is still high, and there is no obvious market-oriented transformation trend at the business level.  

;

;(At the request of the interviewees, Ren Hua, Wu Ming, and Huang Hui are pseudonyms.)
